Award.AwardTitle: SBIR Outreach: Oregon Entrepreneurs Network's Year-Round Outreach Program
Award.AbstractNarration:
The broader/commercial impacts of this project include the enhancement and improvement of scientific, engineering and/or educational activities and benefit the high technology research community by enhancing their entrepreneurial ecosystem. The goals include the following: (1) providing entrepreneur education to help founders and their teams understand the due diligence process, pitching to investors and funding strategies; (2) providing connection building between startups and investors to expand the local capital network; (3) providing a venue for connecting entrepreneurs to mentors, advisors, and guidance; (4) providing access to capital for early-stage companies. The workshops aim at outreach to, and education of, the broader entrepreneurial community.

The intellectual merit of this project includes a series of substantive, engaging workshops/events focused on catalyzing the education of investors and entrepreneurs; showcasing innovative startups; and connecting the companies with potential investment. The program focuses on key points for the entrepreneurial community such as best practices for startup businesses, fund raising strategies, expanding and and leveraging networks, as well as connecting entrepeneurs to advisors and mentors.

Institution.Name: Oregon Entrepreneurs Forum dba Oregon Entrepreneurs Network

Performance_Institution.Name: Oregon Entrepreneurs Forum dba Oregon Entrepreneurs Network

POR.DRECONTENT:
The Oregon Entrepreneurs Network Angel Oregon Year Round Program included a series of substantive,engaging events focused on catalyzing the education of investors and entrepreneurs; showcasing innovative startups; and connecting the most promising companies with investment. The program also featured a high profile keynote presentation which focused on education for both investors and entrepreneurs and included information on multiple funding opportunities available through angel investments, the SBIR and other resources.

The goals of the program included:

1. Providing investor education by leveraging knowledge and best practices from some of the communities most experienced angel investors;

2. Providing entrepreneur education to help founders and their teams understand the due diligence process, pitching to investors and funding strategies;

3. Providing connection building between startups and investors to expand the capital networking Oregon;

4. Connecting entrepreneurs to mentors, advisors, and guidance;

5. Providing help with entrepreneur business models;

6. Increasing deal flow for investors;

7. Providing access to capital for early-stage companies.

Intellectual Merit : The OEN Angel Oregon Year Round Program tracked: a) the number of technology companies presenting their businesses for investment; b) the number of technology companies receiving investment; c) the number of investors participating and d) the total amount invested in promising technology companies.

Broader Impacts : The OEN Angel Oregon Year Round Program contributed to the enhancement and improvement of scientific, engineering and/or educational activities and benefited the high technology community by broadening the awareness of multiple funding opportunities including angel investment,the NSF SBIR and other programs.

Specific Outcomes/Results of the 2014 Fall Program:

1. 22 tech companies presented their businesses

2. 20 investors participated

3. FINEX Cast Iron Cookware, a consumer product company, won a $60,000 investment 

Specific Outcomes/Results of the 2015 Angel Oregon Showcase Program:

1. 17 tech companies presented thier business plans

2. 34 investors participated

3. SpaceView, a software company that provides effortless residential and commercial space design solutions, won a $247,625 investment.

 


Last Modified: 02/12/2016
Modified by: Robin L Cope
